solution_line_template: Lisa makes {eggs_per_child} eggs/child x {num_children} children = {eggs_for_children} eggs for her children.

She makes {eggs_for_husband} eggs for her husband + {eggs_for_lisa} for herself + {eggs_for_children} for her children = <<{eggs_for_husband}+{eggs_for_lisa}+{eggs_for_children}={eggs_per_breakfast}>>{eggs_per_breakfast} eggs.

Lisa makes breakfast {days_per_week} days a week for {weeks_per_year} weeks a year, so {days_per_week} * {weeks_per_year} = <<{days_per_week}*{weeks_per_year}={num_breakfasts}>>{num_breakfasts} breakfasts.
So Lisa makes {eggs_per_breakfast} eggs/breakfast x {num_breakfasts} breakfasts = <<{eggs_per_breakfast}*{num_breakfasts}={total_eggs}>>{total_eggs} eggs.
